intro: Psittacanthus bicalyculatus, commonly known as the two-lobed strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that have a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are clustered in dense, terminal spikes and are often brightly colored, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant in some regions.
